When I was told while booking the hotel that we were being upgraded from a double to queen beds it wasn't clear that it was ONE bed. Luckily there was only two of us the first day, but two more were coming in for days two and three. The clerk at the front desk accommodated us by providing a rollaway bed the first night and offering us an upgraded poolside room for the next two nights. The poolside room had a lot more space and was fine for our needs. Overall the front desk clerk was very courteous and helpful. The hotel was great for walking access to the Hollywood attractions along Hollywood Blvd and the walk of stars area. We also visited Universal Studios, Magic Mountain, and the beaches (Venice & Malibu). Universal was very close and that made it easy to get there early in the day. Trying to plan your driving to avoid rush hour can be helpful. It was nice to have the pool to jump into after hitting the beach. It was clean and decent sized. The poolside room was roomy and had modern 32" LCD televisions. Our first room with one queen bed was quite a bit smaller and darker since it wasn't a poolside room. If I went back, I would definitely opt for a poolside room (some have mini-kitchens, ours did)

Reviews.Title: “Ok room, rude manager”
Reviews.Author: IsamiHandle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on part of our road tour around west U.S.A. after trawling around hollywood trying to get a decent motel. We only wanted a night or two to see the usual sights and have a stress free time. The guy on the door early evening was a very helpfull young guy who said it was no problem to let them know if we would require another night in the morning before check out time (11) but we could check out at the latest at 12. The stay was ok and the room was fine, the location was close to the boulevard which seemed a little tacky and rough around the edges. In the morning i asked to extend our stay as we felt we could do more sight seeing. This time it was a woman at the desk and without a batter of an eyelid said they were full.... I explained we allready had a room and that i was told should i want it again i should let them know before 11am. Fair enough they run a hotel and i can understand them selling the room before i had a chance to book it again... no big deal. At around 11 am we were packing up and i got a phone call from the same woman explaining we had to be out now. I said i would go and speek to her at reception. I got there and told her that i thouht we had to be out by 12 at the latest. She took a very judgemental tone and started saying she wanted us out right away. I said this wasnt possible and she started to say she would charge us. I told her about the staff member from the night before and she said she would sack him. By this point i lost my rag with her and suggested she was a misserable person who was not happy with her job and she proceeded to threated me with the police. I explained i would not be leaving until 12 and that she would not be charging me. She eventually refused to talk with me and requested to talk to the card holder ( my girlfriend ) to which she eventully allowed us to stay till 12. Thanks a bunch... In my view i wouldnt bother with hollywood... and certainly not with this hotel. Oh and the pool is not the same as in the picture. Its smaller. Do visit Griffith Observatory and instead stay close by perhaps at venice beach? Its not a far drive and its alot nicer.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice staff and service...!”
Reviews.Author: Bettina1973
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for 3 nights, but ended up staying 10 days at Days Inn. We come from Denmark (Europe) and we had to go and get my mental ill brother home from L.A. We had a LOT of problems with the american system and problems with finding my brother...But the staff was just SO helpful and very understanding for our situation, especially one lady, she was really nice! They rented a car for us and called the airline company. So the front desk staff was really the top! - But the rooms are very old and dark - the AC/heater did not work at all (it was very cold in LA when we were there). They tried to fix it but they couldn't so we got a transportable one, but that broke down after 3 nights. They have an elevator, but don't use it - it's just SO slow and we really mean slow-you can't imagine! The pool looked nice and clean and the breakfast was okay, a lot of different cereals and bagels with jam and creamy cheese - juice tea and coffe. There's a coffemaker at the room and they leave coffebeans and tea for you every day - nice service! You also have your own refrigiator, that's also a good thing. The cleaning is also fine...We were very satisfied with our stay. Some of the things we missed while we were there was: A manual for the tv and for the AC and an inside smoking room, you were not allowed to smoke at your room or inside the hotel, only at the pool area. We would stay there again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds ever & small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: sgtburg
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on three business trips. Not my idea but that of the company I work for. This last trip, May 4, 2009, I was given a suite with king bed. The room was clean and the entrance door to the bathroom was so narrow, I almost had to walk sideways through it. Bathroom was clean but the towels were worn. The bed, as with all the beds in the rooms I have stayed in, in this hotel are as hard as rocks. I've slept on granite while backpacking in the Sierra's that was more comfortable. Now for the air conditioning. There is a small unit above the entrance door to the room. To operate this device, you must use a remote control. Trying to get it to work correctly it should come with an operations manual. On the inner court yard of the hotel is a swimming pool area with chairs and tables. This area is very clean but I can't say the same for the pool itself. At the bottom of the pool was lots of dirt. It looked like it hadn't been vacuumed out for over a week. If you stay here, ask for a room at the back of the hotel as during the day and night it can get a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!! Waste of Time & Money”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Thang
Reviews.Content: The photos are so mis leading-seriously! The only luxury or fancy place in the whole hotel is the front desk! The elevator is so tiny-that it only fit my suitcase and I. (And I'm only 138 lbs!!) Next when I went to find my room it felt like I was in prison-going thru a maze-it has slits through the walls-I guess to ventilate the area because it has no AC! Finally, I got to my room to find out that it was dreadfully hot! I assumed it was that way because the ac wasn't on-turned out that the ac didn't work-so they brought me a fan!! The floor was uneven-the room was small-the bathroom was tiny with a tiny window that was opened. I complained about the ac they came out to fix it-didn't work-told me to wait a half an hour-then brought me a fan like I said. Didn't even move me to a different room!! Luckily, I just stayed there a couple hours coming from Universal-never again!! I paid $125.31-for a king sized bedroom-in which they told me the original price was $101 plus tax was $117-but apprently changed! Please don't waste your time-I recommend the Days Inn at Glendale-cheaper, nicer, and great staff!! Regina

Reviews.Title: “Excuse me, It's not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: TheEuge
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel from Jan 6-12, 2009. We booked a room with 2 double beds, one for us and one for our 3 kids. Since our trip had us travelling around Los Angeles the whole day this hotel is actually a decent place to sleep in! Everything may not be five star but all the minimum requirements were there and they all worked. The lobby is clean and decent, the receptionist was friendly and helpful when we asked for: hot water, spoon and forks, a cart for our luggage during different times of the day. The elevators were small but forgivable. The hallway was not the widest I've seen but that's negligible. The rooms were of a good size. No undesirable odors. Aside from the 2 beds there were night tables, a flat panel TV, a kitchen area (good for 2 persons) with table for 2, kitchen counter, fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. There was a small closet that had an iron and board. This room had a balcony that overlooked the small swimming pool. We didn't use it but it added a nice touch. The bathroom was ok, was of decent size and clean. Hot water, toiletries and working fixtures had us going about our business without delay. The staff was courteous. They didn't sing and dance when we walked past but when we went back to our room it was made up and cleaned. This place is near an In N Out Burger restaurant, an IHOP restaurant, a 7-11, a Subway restaurant and also a Hawaiian restaurant with decent food. I almost forgot to mention that they serve complimentary continental breakfast at the ground floor dining hall. Cereals, bread and bagels, fruits, coffee and juice were good enough. We went to Disneyland and Universal Studios for 3 days out of our stay and this hotel had good proximity to the 101 freeway. 45 mins to Disneyland and 10 mins to Universal Studios. Overall we paid USD 680 for six nights in this room, tax included. We chucked our luggage in the room, slept, woke up, showered, left, came back to the room at night, did some TV then slept. Everything worked. So if you are looking for good value for money, this place delivers. I would probably stay at a better hotel if I planned to actually STAY at that hotel. But since our expectation was for just a place to sleep in, Days Inn Hollywood exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: pollyg08
Reviews.Content: As my subject says, I am very impressed with this hotel. The clerk that works there in the evening is friendly and helpful. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, the carpet was a little old but clean also. And wow.. 5 pillows... I was excited. Most hotels I stayed at only give 2. 3 if it was my lucky day. And these aren't the flat ones either. Nice and fluffy. Comfy bed, and a nice sized televison. They have secure underground parking and their location is close to lots of things to do. There is an Inn & Out right next door, and a 24 hour IHOP across the street. When I saw the price, I was a little worried it was going to be like other 2-3 star hotels... but no, I was very surprised. GREAT value in my opinon. Only downside was the lady in the morning at checkout seemed very impatient to get us to leave.. looked annoyed when I asked her where the nearest gas station and entrance to the freeway was. They could probably work on their customer service just a tiny bit but otherwise, it is a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: TahitiGirl
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! My company's travel co-ordinator booked us at this hotel as we were taking a class at a nearby location. One night was all we could stand. Where to begin?? The elevator was not level with the floor so you had to step about 10 inches entering or exiting the elevator. The room was smelly, the air conditioing broke in both my room and my business associate's room in the middle of the night and phone calls to the front desk resulted in an "oh, sorry." There was black hair in my bed, which was rock hard by the way. The television reception was nothing but static and snow. The toiletries in the bathroom were half used. And when I got out of the shower in the morning a HUGE glob of black hair fell out of the towel. I know the hotel has little to no control over the actions of its guests, but I have reason to beleive that the people in the room next to me were dealing drugs. Every 5 minutes from 8 pm to 4 am there was a knock at the door. People stayed no more than 3 to 4 minutes and then left. Because the walls were paper thin I could hear their conversations. At one point one of the occupants asked how the individual was able to get into the hotel because you need a room to key to go everywhere. He then said he always had to go get his other clients. Oh, and then there was the hooker who we ran into in the elevator. I live in Las Vegas and work in a downtown office building so trust me I know what a nasty, cheap hooker looks like. When we checked out early we told the desk clerk why we were leaving anad she simply shrugged her shoulders. We ended up moving to a Holiday Inn Express about 1/4 of a mile away which was brand new and cost less than his horrible hotel! Don't waste your money or safety..stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a Great Place in Downtown Hollywood?”
Reviews.Author: owlcroft
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find! We had two events on Hollywood Boulevard and needed rooms for more than 20 people. The hotel gave us a group discount, the location was only 3 blocks from our events, and the amenities were great. All the employees were friendly, courteous, and helpful. The room was basic, but comfortable and the pool was fabulous! If noise is an issue, you can ask for a "quiet" room and the parking was incredibly convenient and inexpensive. Breakfast is also fairly basic, but the choice of breadstuffs was very good. You can't beat this place for the combination of price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad... some issues”
Reviews.Author: zoodles23
Reviews.Content: The parking was gated underground, which for the neighbourhood was good. The room we had overlooked the pool, and it was clean, although small. The bathroom was in severe need of a remodel. It didn't look nice, shower wasn't great and toilet ran a long time. We went to grab a bite to eat and came back and our key wouldn't work. Staff had to call maintenance for us, and it took forever to get back in. This happened three times during our stay, but the other two we were able to try again and again and make it work ourselves. (very inconvenient) The steps near the outdoor pool had a pipe sticking out and I tripped and fell. Very dangerous. It could easily be fixed but it wasn't while we were there. (it's obvious) There is an In and Out Burger and a great shoe outlet store right nearby. You can walk to Hollywood Walk of Fame and we did that. (wouldn't recommend doing at night) The hotel had signs up about an ant problem, but we didn't see any. It wasn't too bad, I would stay there again for a night or two, but not overly impressed, especially for what we paid!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated It”
Reviews.Author: ZENJAM
Reviews.Content: Worst experience at a hotel EVER. We have stayed at many different hotels in the Hollywood area from the Roosevelt to the Saharan and the Days Inn on Sunset was by far the worst. We checked in on an extremly hot day, and found out that our rooms Air Conditioning was broken and they were postive that it worked even though there was a standing fan in the room. i have never had a standing fan in any hotel room I have ever stayed at. We got down graded to another room with a queen bed ( we had made reservations for a King) and no fridge. At that time I was just hot and wanted to take a nap in a cool room before I headed out to a show I was atteneding so I didnt complain. About 10 minutes into my nap I heard a saw and someone hammering in the room right next to us. Apparently they were do renvovations on the suite right next door to our room. I called down and told the front desk that this was unexceptable and that I should be entitled to a discount or something because of one the down graded room and because their "PROMISE AS SURE AS THE SUN" States (As our guest, you can expect warm hospitality and clean, comfortable rooms where everything works, to make your stay trouble-free and enjoyable. We work hard to earn our reputation as "The Best Value Under the Sun." We are personally responsible and strive to ensure you have an exceptional stay with us. We are prepared to resolve any situation that does not meet our high standards. As your Hosts, we are empowered to meet your needs in a timely manner. We are pleased to provide useful local recommendations and information. We are proud to be your friendly, attentive and professional Hosts. Our greatest compliment is for you to return to us or any other Days InnÂ® location worldwide for "The Best Value Under the Sun." I not only did not get friendly service , the MANAGER does not work on weekends when the htoel is fully booked, and their HIGH STANDARDS IS TOTAL BS. I WILL NEVER STAY AT A DAYS INN AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: WiseJJ
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for five nights with my family. We were on vacation in southern California and enjoyed the hole experience a lot. This hotel was no exception. The best things abouth this hotel were the rates, the location, and the underground parking. The neighbourhood is nice and felt safe enough to walk. It's a few minutes' walk away from attractions in Hollywood. In Sunset boulevard there's a lot to do too, like restaurants, night clubs (for those interested) and shops. Other great attractions are close by, like Universal Studios, Griffith Park, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and downtown. The hotel looked nice and was very clean; the staff friendly, helpful and efficient. The room with two double beds could have been a little bigger, but was ok. By the way, I personally had no trouble with noises due to the "thin" walls. Everything worked well. The lobby is nice, has a computer with internet access and printer. The breakfast area is tiny, but the food offered was good enough, although without a lot of variety. The pool I never used, but looked nice. In summary, I would definetely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This has got to be a joke...”
Reviews.Author: trillimer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading these reviews and I have to say, my experience wasn't even close to anything written here. I generally stay in 2 and 3 star hotels, so my expectations are not that high. But this has got to be the worst hotel I've ever been in. While the location can't be beat, I would recommend you stay somewhere a little further away for cheaper and use the money you've saved to pay for parking or taxis. You'll have a better experience, trust me. First of all, the place is aged and falling apart. The lobby and outside appear to be in order, but the room itself was ridiculous. Peeling and worn wallpaper, huge hole in the carpet, large holes where pictures have been moved/removed, discolored ceiling, and a terrible smell are what greeted me when I walked in the door. Then, while trying to use the shower, my husband nearly scalded himself because the temperature control takes a full 2 minutes to respond to any changes. Now, I'm a pretty intelligent person, but I don't think it takes a rocket scientist to figure out how to use a shower. The drain in the shower was also slow and I was disgusted at what I had to stand in. The a/c originally appeared to not be working and when I brought this up to Juliana, a member of the front desk staff, she snottily asked me, "Did you press the mode button?" Like I worked for Carrier and automatically knew that was what you were supposed to do, especially since there were absolutely no instructions and the a/c in every other hotel in the world has an on/off button and temperature controls and that's all you need to know. This girl had someone come to my room to get the a/c to work, but it took him 10 minutes to figure it out. So if it takes a member of the staff 10 minutes to get it to work, why I should I be expected to do it at all? Then, when I brought up the matter of the shower temperature, she didn't actually address me but turned to the other girl at the desk and said, "That shower works, right?" I couldn't believe it...this girl actually just called me a liar. I replied that no, it wasn't, because I just told her it wasn't, and the matter regarding the shower was dropped and never taken care of. I brought my grievances up to a different front desk clerk the next morning and asked to speak to the manager, but apparently he doesn't feel it necessary to work on weekends, when hotels are the busiest. As a matter of fact, there wasn't a maintenance person working either which leads me to believe that the management at this hotel is amateurish at best. I have reported my experiences with Days Inn and have put a call in to the hotel manager but have not received a response as of this time. I would recommend you take your business elsewhere...you'll thank me later.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: mrHedman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Hollywood. Right on the Sunset Strip for a great price. Have stayed here twice now, and ill be back, thats 100% sure!!! Great service from the staff, the airline "lost" my luggage on my way to L.A, but Days Inn provided me with shampoo, razors...you name it....realy, REALY great service!!! I loved the pool-area, relaxing there you felt like being miles away from the busy Sunset Strip, sitting just a few meters away. No noise from the street or anything. Two thumbs up and top rating from this Norwegian!! Highly Recomended Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “first night in usa”
Reviews.Author: hollinger
Reviews.Content: arrived a bit early after a long flight from New Zealand but no problems, helpful and friendly front desk. room great as we are a family of 4 adults so clean and tidy. great place to explore Hollywood and LA from, good parking in the complex, spent two days here. so thanks days inn.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Cramzon
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location. Great price. Cons: Thin walls, parking. I stayed at the Days Inn during a business trip in Hollywood. The location is perfect and within walking distance to Grauman's threatre. The decor was great and the pool was very nice. Breakfast was free, with an assortment of bagels, cereal and fruits. My only concern was with privacy. Since Hollywood is a quite the party town, it tends to stay noisy until the late hours. The sounds of sex would permeate my room throughout the night. Parking was difficult as I had to park at the In'n'Out next door to collect the parking pass before I had access to the parking garage. Don't expect to just drive in before you check-in. Internet was also free and their wide-open router makes it easy to connect from anywhere in the hotel or the restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: AfkeAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Before i went to LA i red the reviews on here and was dreading staying at this hotel.. but because of the location I stayed here anyway. I don't regret doing so. The hotel is fine. It's not the Hilton, but it's clean, my friend and i had room enough for our stuff, the staff was very friendly and helpfull and the continantal breakfast was better then i've had in other hotels in the USA. I enjoyed the pool and the balcony that we had. The security is excelent! I had friends in the area and they came over while i was there, and everytime someone did, the really nice lady at the desk called up to say someone was asking for me and if i knew them and was willing to come down to greet them. If you want to stay in Hollywood, near the Walk of Fame (Hollywood Blvrd is only 5 min walk away, if that) I'd reccomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to sights in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MisterMVA
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be quite adequate. The room was small but worked fine for us - we only stayed one night. Many of the rooms are centered around a small pool. We found it to be clean, the staff to be friendly, and the breakfast was great (continental). Parking is available under the hotel - I think they charged $5 per night extra for it. There are plenty of places to eat nearby. The best part of this place was that we were able to walk to the Chinese theatre, Walk of Fame, and Kodak theatre at night. Good for a short stay but probably a bit uncomfortable (not big enough) for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Pen4Claire
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this hotel looks ok. However, on entering it is a totally different ball game! The service was below average with the left hand not knowing what the right hand was doing! We were given our keys , but when we arrived at the room, it had not been serviced,. The bed was ruffled from the previous guests, rubbish in bins, bathroom in a real state. We returned the keys and asked for the room to be ready on our return from Universal Studios. When we did return, the room had been serviced. I didn't sleep a wink as the shutters on the windows were banging around as they had been vandalised and not repaired. THe shower was like something from the film 'Schindler's list' - really dirty, dark and scary! We passed on the free buffett breakfast when we saw the plastic plates and cups! I would not recomment this hotel and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the name!”
Reviews.Author: hurricaneman
Reviews.Content: Days Inn used to mean a decent stay.. but NOT HERE!!! I was booked here for 4 weeks for a business trip to Hollywood, and I will NEVER make that mistake again. Don't be fooled by the lobby. The property is very old, and the rooms are dirty and very worn. Bring ear plugs or be prepared to run your AC at full, because the walls AND CEILING are paper thin. You can here every word (among other things) from the rooms around you. And every step someone made above me sounded llike the roof was caving in. Since I was a high-paying customer with an extended stay, I asked the front desk workers for a different room, and kept getting the run-around. If you have a car, the underground parking is useful, but NOTHING else. Sunset Blvd in this area at night is very shady, and the road noise is constant along the front of the property. In the back is a low-rent high-rise so be prepared for parties and shouting from that area. Breakfast is a total JOKE. Milk consistantly warm, food area unclean, and the workers weird and unfriendly... and, of course, mostly non-english speaking. This area of Hollywood (around the Highland Center) has very little hotel options, unless you want to stay at the Roosevelt or Renaissance for $400/night. Be VERY careful when choosing hotels around here. I've traveled to this area four times, and have done a ton of research into the hotels. You're much better off staying in West Hollywood or Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LeifH
Reviews.Content: We are 5 persons (3 children + parents) - and got a room with 2 queen beds and a rollaway bed for 127 dollar on their website. The deal was that getting this price I couldn't cancel. The hotel is very good located on Sunset boulevard 5 minutes from the walk of fame, Kodac theatre and so on. Great parking for 5 dollars a night in the basement. It is much weight on security. You need you card to actually enter the corridors with the rooms, the pool area and so on. The pool is great, the WIFI is great, breakfast above average. Tip - when you order - you might like the the rooms in the 2 floor which has a small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: jacal
Reviews.Content: I checked out of this hotel yesterday (4/6/2007) after a wonderful five day stay. The room is on the small side, but it was very clean, the maids did a great job, they even cleaned my coffee pot each morning. The pool looked nice and it's heated, but i didn't go swimmming because the weather was too cool. There are sliding glass doors in the rooms on the first floor that face the pool, but you can't access the pool from the room because there is a planter with flowers right in front of it, and there is a sign that says you can't jump over the planter, you must access the pool from a hallway door. If I stay here again, i would stay on the second floor so i could sit on a chair on the balcony facing the pool.. The continental breakfast consists of pre-packaged pastries, bagels, toast, cereal, oatmeal, and fruits. which was enough for me, I was happy with it. The staff is very nice and helpful, one employee even looked up locations on the internet for me when he didn't know the directions. There is garage parking at a $5.00 a day fee. There is no access to the garage, elevator, or hallways without a keycard. Several restaurants, shops, the metro station, and Hollywood Blvd are all with walking distance of the hotel. The one single thing that bothered me had nothing to do with the hotel, it's the neighborhood that made me apprehensive. The neighborhood has a few strip clubs, and I noticed a few unsavory characters walking around at night, but no one bothered me. The hotel is right across the street from Hollywood High School, so I thought it was terrible that strip clubs are located so close to students. I have a feeling that the neighborhood is probably worse than I was thinking while I was there. If I stay there again, I would not stay alone like I did on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stepped into. We were supposed to stay in Hollywod for one day we booked this hotel and when we got there just by the looks of the outside and the surrounding area we were disgusted but we gave the hotel a chance and went in, the lobby was ok so we asked to see the room before we checked in. We started to head to the room which was on the second floor when walking up to the room the first floor carpeting and walls were flithy and the halls smelled like urine, once we entered the room it was even more flithy then the hallways. The carpet and walls had stains on them the bedspread had cigarette burns in them, the moldings were off the wall and lying on the floor. We told the man showing us the room that we did not want to stay so we went back down to the front desk and advised the lady that we did not want to stay so told us we had no choice b/c we did not give proper notice we told her that they should be ashamed to even rent that room b/c it was so disgusting so she rudely banged on her computer ripped a sheet of paper out of the printer and threw it at us and said there is your cancellation. This hotel is in walking distance but you might get mugged on the way to it. I guess we should have known that it wasn't a good neighborhood as soon as we got off the highway and we saw bums, garbage all over the street, bars on the windows & doors. This was my first and last time in Hollywood. I would have never thought that a $150/night hotel within walking distance Kodak Theatre, Grauman's & the Walk of Frame could have been this horrible. You could not pay me enough to stay in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice hotel...would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was friendly and helpful,the Days Inn on Sunset Blvd. is not a hotel I would recommend to a friend. The matresses in our room were very hard (I don't mind firm but these were like cement). My son tried to sleep on a roll-a-way bed which was terrible, so he ended up putting the mattress on the floor and sleeping. The bathroom mirror was difficult to use since there was a window in the center of it. I don't expect too much when a hotel says it has a continetal breakfast, but this was not good. Mostly pre-packaged pastries and coffee that was just o.k. I would have put up with all of this and not written this review, but the thing that bothered me the most was the musty smell in the rooms (we had 2 rooms) and the mold that was around the peeling wallpaper in the bathroom. I ended up with a sore throat because of it, so just wanted to warn anyone who is sensitive to mold to not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: jess98ac
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night on a recent CA trip. We were in town for a wedding so just needed someplace to stay that was close enough to the wedding to take a cab and this hotel was recommended as being just that by the bride and groom. The room was clean, didn't have any ant or toilet problems as previously reported. The elevator is PAINFULLY slow, but we only used it when we had our bags. The lobby was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful...they called a cab for us and called our room when it arrived. The parking garage is convenient and complimentary (from what I remember). The only complaint was that there's no light in the shower so it was a little dark in there. I would stay here again if we were in town for a couple nights...not sure I'd spend a week or anything, but it more than served it's purpose for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: zoey9797
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed two nights last March. We paid 50.00/night and were happy with it.It was a standard hotel room, nothing fancy but our room was clean (bug free :O), the pool was nice. Parking was good. It is close enough to walk to Hollywood Blvd- actually closer than we had thought...I would guess about 5 minutes or so and we felt safe. The staff was very nice and helped us figure out the evening hotspots and other must see areas and also the places to avoid. Really good experience- We enjoyed our stay and the budget price. We are intending to stay again this spring :O) ~Zoey

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jlowry24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Days Inn for one night last week and thought it was fine, especially given some of the negative reviews here. The clerk at the front desk was friendly and helpful, even after I somehow managed to lose my room key before getting to the room. The room itself was small-ish but clean, with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The only problem I had was with noise. The window from my room looked out on an internal hallway, so I was woken up a couple of times by people talking as they walked by. If you're a light sleeper request a room at the back of the hotel I guess. I had to leave early so didn't have a chance to check out the pool or continental breakfast, but overall I would recommend this hotel if you're looking to stay for one or two nights in the Hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accomodation for the cost!!!”
Reviews.Author: sh204
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last 4 nights of our vacation there and it was very convenient to all tourist stuff and lots of restaurants within 2 min walking distance. Very very clean room. Bathroom all worked fine. Fridge was great. Nice pool view (although unfortuntately we didn't have enough time to actually use it). Great free continental breakfast. Good parking. Everyone seemed friendly enough. Slight problem with being charged different rate than I had booked but we mostly figured it out. I would definitely stay here again. If you are looking for a 5 star to LIVE at, go to the Beverly Hills Hotel. If you are looking for somewhere comfortable to sleep and great location for the cost, definitely don't pass this one up. Just book early to get the best rates.
